questions.question_text: What allows a security administrator to preview the Security policy rules that match new application signatures?
If using group mapping with Active Directory Universal Groups, what must you do when configuring the User ID?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
Answer : C
https://docs.paloaltonetworks.com/best-practices/10-1/user-id-best-practices/user-id-best-practices/user-id-best-practices-for-group-mapping
If you have Universal Groups, create an LDAP server profile to connect to the root domain of the Global Catalog server on port 3268 or 3269 for SSL.

Selected Answer: C
If you have Universal Groups, create an LDAP server profile to connect to the root domain of the Global Catalog server on port 3268 or 3269 for SSL.

choices.A: Configure a Primary Employee ID number for user-based Security policies.
choices.C: Create an LDAP Server profile to connect to the root domain of the Global Catalog server on port 3268 or 3269 for SSL.
choices.D: Configure a frequency schedule to clear group mapping cache.
choices.B: Create a RADIUS Server profile to connect to the domain controllers using LDAPS on port 636 or 389.

questions.question_text: Which plane on a Palo Alto Networks Firewall provides configuration, logging, and reporting functions on a separate processor?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
Management is part of the control plane while data plane incorporate security network and signature

Selected Answer: A
Control plan is the correct answer.
A is correct. The Management plane will handle this.
Management LAN is on control Plan
In all official content available the management plane doesn't exist. It is the control plane, this makes learning incredibly confusing

Correct Answer is A: 
App-ID Updates and Impact
Firewall administrators must be careful before they install any App-ID updates because some applications might have changed since the last App-ID update (content update). For example, an application that previously was categorized under web-browsing now might be categorized under its own unique App-ID. Categorization of applications into more specific applications enables more granularity and control of applications within Security policy rules. Because the new App-ID no longer will be categorized as web-browsing, no Security policy rule now will contain this new App-ID. Consequently, the new App-ID will be blocked.

Selected Answer: A
A is correct.

questions.question_text: What are two differences between an implicit dependency and an explicit dependency in App-ID? (Choose two.)

choices.D: An explicit dependency requires the dependent application to be added in the security policy
choices.C: An explicit dependency does not require the dependent application to be added in the security policy
choices.A: An implicit dependency does not require the dependent application to be added in the security policy
choices.B: An implicit dependency requires the dependent application to be added in the security policy
